item.title: CSS Battery Indicator
item.description: Created a simple CSS battery indicator today, thought I’d share it with you all. <div class="batteryContainer"> <div class="batteryOuter"><div id="batteryLevel"></div></div> <div class="batteryBump"></div> </div> .batteryContainer { display: -webkit-box; display: -moz-box; display: -ms-flexbox; display: -webkit-flex; display: flex; flex-direction: row; align-items: center; } .batteryOuter { border-radius: 3px; border: 1px solid #444; padding: 1px; width: 25px; height: 9px; } .batteryBump { border-radius: 2px; background-color: #444; margin: 2px; width: 1px; height: 3px; } #batteryLevel { border-radius: 2px; background-color: #73AD21; width: 18px; height: 9px; } JSFiddle

item.title: Photos
item.description: I been a keen photographer for many years. It started with a film camera, developoing black & white photos in the darkroom. The feeling when you develop your contact prints and then see the full-sized photo emerge from the chemicals; I love that process. For over 3 years I took a photo every day and posted it to Blipfoto. They was a massive help in seeing photos, as the pressure of it being daily forces you to look everywhere for a photo.

item.title: Updating a website
item.description: Introduction Last time I switch the design of my blog, I switched to Hugo. After a bit of theme customization I had a pretty good working system. However, it didn’t take long until I tweaked one of the static generated output files. This tweaking continued for the next few years… until now. I’ve stuck with Hugo, but have chosen a different theme and made my customizations - mostly to make it work like a fully functioning website (with a blog), and not just a ‘single page site’, or a ‘blog with an simple about page’.
